title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 20 December 2012 - XWiki
content:
<Denis> has quit  
00:08 <abusenius> has quit  
00:33 <polx> has quit  
01:07 <Slashman> has quit  
03:37 <tekzilla> has quit  
03:39 <tekzilla> has joined #xwiki  
04:30 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
06:00 <Denis> has quit  
07:03 <polx> has joined #xwiki  
08:15 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
08:19 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
09:05 <Denis> mflorea: Good morning, are you the one to talk to about the DW ui ?  
09:05 <mflorea> good morning Denis, yes  
09:06 <Denis> I am trying it for the first time on a copy of a production farm  
09:06 <Denis> really a great job at first sight (not finish testing !)  
09:07 <Denis> however, I found the listbox for choosing between new, current or merged not really efficient  
09:07 <vmassol> Denis: good morning, if you have a few minutes, I've left you a skype message  
09:07 <Denis> vmassol: let me look  
09:09 <vmassol> thanks  
09:10 <Denis> mflorea: wouldn't direct button be better for the task, and have it in one click in place of 3  
09:11 <mflorea> Denis: you mean replace the list box with 3 buttons?  
09:11 <Denis> mflorea: this may also limit the impact of the default choice, since it is not always obvious  
09:11 <msmeria> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <Denis> mflorea: yes  
09:12 <Denis> I have a lot of answer to give for a farm, and it is really boring to always change from new to current  
09:12 <mflorea> and where would you display the explanation? Right now each list item explains what it does  
09:13 <mflorea> Denis: that's another topic  
09:13 <Denis> not really, why ?  
09:14 <mflorea> I talked with vmassol about remembering the last choice or having a "apply this action to next/similar conflicts"  
09:14 <Denis> if I compare to APT, which provide similar idea, the keyboard is really faster to the task, but not intuitive for a web page, this is why button seems to me better  
09:14 <Denis> do not like the idea much, at least for now, since there are still awkward issue  
09:15 <Denis> for example, group are not merged properly  
09:17 <mflorea> ok, but we need to distinguish between merge/conflicts that shouldn't happen (we need to improve the merge), and the use case when the conflict is expected and there are many such expected conflicts and you want to apply the same action to all/part of them  
09:18 <mflorea> you said "it is really boring to always change from new to current" --> so you want to apply "current" too all, or at least it should be remembered and selected for the next conflict  
09:18 <Denis> well, this would be true when we answer the same many times, for now I do not really  
09:19 <Denis> even between wikis, the results differ  
09:19 <mflorea> but remembering the last answer should fix the problem of selecting "current" again right?  
09:20 <mflorea> my only issue with buttons is that the button label is limited and you need to think of a good label, and I'm not sure where to display the explanation text (tooltip? not that visible)  
09:20 <Denis> maybe, yes, but it may be no seen, not an easy deal  
09:21 <Denis> the question is "Which version do you want to use ?" Current, Merged, New  
09:21 <Denis> there may be some explanation in the tips above, to increase the understanding  
09:22 <mflorea> yes, but I don't it's clear for all users what current/merged/new means  
09:22 <Denis> the diff provide the real answer IMO  
09:22 <mflorea> plus the warning that new may overwrite changes, while current may not work with new version  
09:23 <Denis> anyway, a good tips will do, in the same form than "The document http://cartopass.xwiki4.softec.lu/site/XWiki/XWikiPreferences has changes that could be overwritten during the upgrade."  
09:24 <Denis> rhoo, the expension of the link in my back :(  
09:24 <Denis> by the way, I do have cases where neither of these version are good for me  
09:25 <mflorea> ?  
09:25 <Denis> and selecting class changes, rights changes, contents changes, and object changes individually would be a must !  
09:26 <mflorea> well, ofc, it's in the plan, the idea is to be able to create a "custom" version by editing the changes inline  
09:26 <Denis> for example, a change in XWikiPreferences, on the class, also bring a change of rights that I want to skip  
09:26 <mflorea> yes, sure, it's in the plan  
09:26 <Denis> that would be great of course  
09:27 <Denis> I also got an issue where there is no changes displayed !  
09:27 <mflorea> the next step is to simply exclude some of the changes from the diff, and then to be able to edit the diff  
09:27 <Denis> and 3 versions proposed  
09:28 <mflorea> maybe there was no diff between the selected versions  
09:28 <Denis> merged and new both says no changes  
09:28 <mflorea> (e.g. current and merged, but there were diff between current and new)  
09:28 <Denis> no diff at all  
09:29 <Denis> but I suspect there were some hidden change  
09:29 <Denis> not noticed by the diff engine  
09:29 <mflorea> looks like a bug  
09:29 <Denis> this is not the first time I see it  
09:29 <Denis> but never had enough time to found what is change  
09:33 <Denis> mflorea: would be also great to find a way to avoid all the scrolling, keeping the interface more stable  
09:33 <mflorea> which scrolling?  
09:34 <mflorea> for merge conflict?  
09:34 <Denis> I need to scroll to see changes, than it scroll back up when I confirm until the next conflict where I need to scroll down again  
09:34 <Denis> keeping the conflict choice stable, and the diff scrolling apart would help a lot  
09:35 <Denis> not sure, I to do this precisely, but it is definitely moving too much now  
09:36 <Denis> while importing, the whole page stay in a single window up to now, but once the conflict interface is added I need to scroll to read it  
09:37 <Denis> so, having the conflict interface in a ligthbox would probably help  
09:37 <mflorea> well, I don't like having too many scroll bars, and I prefer the natural flow of text on the web, but I understand your point (you're not the first one to complain about this)  
09:38 <Denis> I am not a fan of lightbox, why not a tabbed interface ?  
09:38 <Denis> on tab for the may process, and one for the conflict  
09:39 <Denis> to avoid the scrolling up/down, you need to split these too in one way or another  
09:39 <mflorea> I'm not sure about the conflict tab  
09:39 <mflorea> what about auto-scrolling to the conflict?  
09:40 <Denis> the problem would be that the size of the conflict will change your ability to scroll  
09:41 <Denis> what is really needed is also to have the listbox (or the buttons ;)) at the same places  
09:41 <mflorea> ok  
09:41 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
09:41 <mflorea> that's something Caty complained about  
09:41 <Denis> I would like to reduce my mouse mouvement as much as possible  
09:42 <mflorea> yep, that's how Caty put it :)  
09:43 <Denis> mflorea: during the conflict resolution, is there a way I can check both document to understand the diffing issue ?  
09:44 <Denis> (just got another "No changes" with no merge but a new)  
09:44 <mflorea> no, I think you have a link to the current doc, but you don't have access to the new/merged  
09:45 <mflorea> (I have access in the code, because I create the diff between the versions, but the versions are not accessible right now)  
09:46 <Denis> ok  
09:47 <mflorea> you should write a mail with all these complains/suggestions and we'll discuss it on devs mailing list. What you see if the first version, so there is room for improvements.  
09:48 <Denis> mflorea: sure, I would like to talk with you since I was not aware of the history and no real time search about the plan, I hope you find my reaction useful, I will surely conclude by a mail  
09:49 <tdelafosse> has joined #xwiki  
09:51 <mflorea> Denis: your feedback is definitely useful! and it matches in some aspects the feedback I got from Caty and others  
09:55 <Denis> mflorea: the do the same action for the rest of the changes, would it be limited to a package ? a wiki ? both ? is the plan detailed about that ?  
10:00 <mflorea> Denis: there is not detailed plan, just an idea  
10:01 <mflorea> re "apply the same action"  
10:01 <Denis> ok, so to feed your idea, I need to skip any change in the Blog application of some wiki, not all  
10:01 <Denis> currently, this is really tedious  
10:02 <Denis> of course, keeping my last choice would help in that case  
10:02 <mflorea> hmm, but DW is working only for the main wiki currently (the second stem, main ui)  
10:02 <mflorea> how do you upgrade the blog in subwikis?  
10:03 <mflorea> s/stem/step  
10:03 <Denis> oh  
10:03 <Denis> I simply install the distribution on the farm, and it seems to upgrade farm one wiki after the other  
10:04 <mflorea> ah, you used Install on farm  
10:04 <Denis> right  
10:04 <Denis> is it prohibited ?  
10:04 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <mflorea> well, normally the main UI is for the main wiki only, and I was supposed to hide the Install on farm button  
10:05 <mflorea> for the DW  
10:05 <mflorea> the subwikis don't have a "main" ui configured  
10:06 <mflorea> the main UI is currently configured for the war  
10:07 <mflorea> afaik subwikis should be upgraded, at least for now (I haven't tested much on multiwiki environment), from the last step (Extensions)  
10:07 <mflorea> in the last step you should see extensions that were installed on subwikis and that have upgrades available  
10:08 <mflorea> (at least this was the intention)  
10:10 <mflorea> but anyway, you idea makes sense: be able to apply the same action on all conflicts from a space (which usually means an app) and a wiki (or workspace)  
10:11 <mflorea> actually "apply this action for the entire extension" makes more sens (where the extension is xwiki-platform-blog-ui for instance)  
10:12 <mflorea> (i.e. for all the conflicts of page from the app xar)  
10:16 <Denis> mflorea: je suis pas encore arrivé au step suivant, beaucoup de conflict...  
10:16 <mflorea> ok :)  
10:16 <Denis> mflorea: sorry, not yet at the next step  
10:17 <Denis> not easy to switch language between chats :)  
10:17 <mflorea> :)  
10:17 <vmassol> :)  
10:17 <vmassol> it's a good exercise ;)  
10:27 <vmassol> note: I'm currently triggering manually the functional tests for 4.4M1 (since they need to be triggerd the first time)  
10:28 <vmassol> since I'm not triggering them in the right order there will be false positives  
10:30 <Denis> mflorea: I may have found an weird issue, I am importing a document with the DW that says language[] and gets a diff with a document I only get with language=en, this is in a subwiki which default to fr, and the main wiki default to en…  
10:32 <Denis> probably due to the fact I import from the main wiki for subwikis  
10:37 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
10:47 <mflorea> I think "language []" means the doc doesn't have the language set, which usually means it has the default language. We need to fix the "language []" display, either don't display the language or say "default language".  
10:47 <Denis> sure, but it doesn't get the right one this time  
10:49 <Denis> and there is probably other weird issue when the wiki is old  
10:49 <Denis> by the way [] does not really means default, in fact it means no language  
10:50 <mflorea> yes, for this I need to implement http://jira.xwiki.org/browse/XWIKI-8252  
10:50 <Denis> which is not exactly the same  
10:50 <tmortagne> Denis: which mean it's the default language version of the document generally  
10:50 <mflorea> yes, which happen in no multilingual environment  
10:51 <Denis> I do not really experience this issue, I have a lot of conflict, but nothing abnormal for the changes I currently apply  
10:51 <Denis> tmortagne: no, it don't  
10:52 <Denis> tmortagne: you may have a no language version, and a localisased version of the same document  
10:53 <Denis> tmortagne: the no language version is not the same as the having a document in the default xwiki language  
10:53 <tmortagne> Denis: the fact that you can create inconsistency in the DB does not make them normal  
10:53 <Denis> tmortagne: the no language version has a lot of meaning, the default language can be changed at anytime  
10:53 <tmortagne> when you as a document without indicating the document you get the document without no language set, so the default one, the one on which objects are associated etc  
10:54 <tmortagne> Denis: I know the default language can be changed and it's going to create a mess  
10:54 <vmassol1> has joined #xwiki  
10:54 <tmortagne> s/without indicating the document/without indicating the language/  
10:55 <Denis> tmortagne: do not mix to different things, the implementation and the fact that a document has no language is unrelated  
10:56 <tmortagne> the document without language is supposed to be the default document, the root one from which you get the translations. It's not just implementation, that's what you get in the API too.  
10:56 <Denis> tmortagne: a document that use the localization modules, is not in a specific language, it is all at ones, and these document shoud not have a language associated to them, else it will be missleading  
10:56 <sdumitriu2> has joined #xwiki  
10:58 <Denis> so we need such document, since most of the document we provide are of that kind. The question is, how to we upgrade them on a multi-lingual where the main document has a language, and on a mono-lingual wiki where it may exists with a language, and a translation (abnormal, but exists)  
11:00 <tmortagne> EM does not care about mono/multi lingual, a unique document is a reference and a language, what you need to find it in the DB and it will upgrade what matches that  
11:00 <Denis> ok, it doesn't  
11:01 <Denis> and this will not work properly on old wiki where some of our no language document get qualified en  
11:02 <tmortagne> i don't understand what you mean either it has a language or it does not  
11:02 <vmassol> has quit  
11:02 <sdumitriu1> has quit  
11:03 <Denis> you have document with language="" and document with language="en"  
11:03 <tmortagne> different documents then  
11:03 <Denis> most of the technical, automatically translated, document we produce should be language=""  
11:04 <Denis> now, I only speak about the default mail document, not about any translations  
11:04 <Denis> s/mail/main  
11:04 <Denis> you may have a main document with language="en", and an upgrade containing a main document with language=""  
11:06 <tmortagne> then it's two different documents  
11:06 <tmortagne> you could also change it's name  
11:06 <Denis> it is the main document, not the translation, and therefore the same, and we currently remove the "en"  
11:07 <Denis> and it could happen on a wiki with a default language = "fr"  
11:07 <Denis> a wiki which will return the "fr" document for &language=  
11:07 <tmortagne> how can getDocument find a document which doe snot have empty language ?  
11:07 <Denis> this is weird  
11:08 <Denis> the main document have a language field, this is the original language  
11:08 <tmortagne> I know it has a language field  
11:09 <Denis> other language are translations  
11:09 <tmortagne> but you don't know this language  
11:09 <tmortagne> when you justr call getDocument without indicating it  
11:09 <Denis> you get the one it has  
11:09 <tmortagne> whcih is why it's supposed to be empty  
11:09 <tmortagne> you generate an id to get the document  
11:09 <tmortagne> you don't ask for the first one it find  
11:11 <Denis> tmortagne: http://troll.ws/image/26c47c6d  
11:11 <tmortagne> that's the default language  
11:11 <tmortagne> not the language  
11:11 <tmortagne> in your screenshot  
11:12 <Denis> that nothing meaningfull  
11:12 <tmortagne> I tough you were saying it was a different language  
11:12 <tmortagne> then we should not display it in the diff UI that's all  
11:13 <Denis> I said that the default language of the wiki is unrelated to that field  
11:13 <tmortagne> sure but it does not change the fact that a document has a field called default language  
11:13 <tmortagne> that's an information  
11:13 <Denis> that field is the original language, not the default one  
11:13 <tmortagne> there is no EM bug here  
11:14 <Denis> as I said EM has a bug, I am talking about DW  
11:14 <tmortagne> Denis: this screenshot iss EM  
11:14 <tmortagne> DW just call EM to install a XAR  
11:14 <Denis> no, the ui display original document, and translated document  
11:15 <Denis> tmortagne: sure, but the goal of DW is the one of EM, or have I missed the goal ?  
11:15 <tmortagne> where do you see the original language ?  
11:15 <Denis> in the editor ui  
11:16 <Denis> on a multilingual wiki of course  
11:16 <tmortagne> (11:14:44 AM) Denis: no, the ui display original document, and translated document  
11:16 <tmortagne> what UI are you talking about  
11:16 <tmortagne> please don't mix everything  
11:16 <tmortagne> what exactly is wrong here ?  
11:17 <Denis> as a developer, I fully get the problem, as a user it is a complete mess  
11:19 <Denis> I am on a french wiki (not multi-lingual), I run the DW, it show a diff about an default language=en document, that it want to update, a document I could only see if I use &language=en, a document it want to update to language[]  
11:19 <Denis> do you see the mess for the end-user ?  
11:20 <tmortagne> Denis: you want EM to skip conflict resolution for a document you can't see in the UI when in mono-lingual mode ?  
11:21 <Denis> tmortagne: I do not want anything, I am just exposing the situation, I have not yet a clear idea on how to solve that mess we have created over time  
11:21 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
11:22 <tmortagne> the issue here is that we have a conflict and it has to be fixed, I understand that you don't want to see a document you don't care because you are never going to use it but it's not some quick bugfix...  
11:22 <Denis> this was simply not the document I expected to be diffed  
11:22 <tmortagne> you see the conflict mostly because of hidden field here  
11:23 <tmortagne> it's not really related to translations  
11:23 <Denis> this is not this document in particular tmortagne  
11:23 <Denis> this one was the one I was on at the time we talk  
11:23 <Denis> the document I had the issue with was Main.WebHome  
11:24 <tmortagne> Denis: if there was no change on the hidden field you would not have seen this conflict  
11:24 <Denis> and it was diffed against it english version, while the one used is the french version  
11:24 <Denis> I was even not aware of any english version of that document, but I would probably be interested in upgrading the french one  
11:25 <tmortagne> that's two different documents, you probably got the french one before or will later  
11:25 <Denis> there is no french, the current is no language !  
11:26 <Denis> we are upgrading the english to no language  
11:26 <Denis> the french translation no more exists or have never existed  
11:27 <tmortagne> of course not we are upgrade the no language to no language, the en you see is what was in the "default language" field, I don't know why the default language field does not have anything anymore but it's completely different  
11:28 <tmortagne> looking at XAppResource page in the XAR  
11:28 <tmortagne> I don't understand what the default language has been removed  
11:28 <polx\_> has joined #xwiki  
11:29 <Denis> tmortagne: my screenshot seems to be another story !  
11:29 <vmassol1> has quit  
11:29 <polx> has quit  
11:29 <polx\_> is now known as <polx>  
11:31 <tmortagne> Denis: ok I get that you are talking like a user but keep repeating this instead of trying to understand why it's happening is not going to fix it...  
11:32 <Denis> tmortagne: http://troll.ws/image/11055072 is worse !  
11:32 <tmortagne> so not the user is not supposed to get this all the time  
11:32 <Denis> tmortagne: that was not my initial point  
11:32 <cjd> hah nice  
11:33 <Denis> tmortagne: we used to have at a time "en" where "" was appropriate, we created translations in mono-lingual wiki at another time, and now we have a mess  
11:33 <cjd> maybe it's coming from java6 (which we require anyway)  
11:33 <tmortagne> Denis: but this has nothing to do with the screenshot you are sending  
11:34 <tmortagne> Rhino is in java 6  
11:34 <cjd> heh so we are guaranteed to have it  
11:34 <Denis> tmortagne: sorry, my screenshot was misleading with my initial point  
11:35 <tmortagne> cjd: jvelo reported an issue about that  
11:35 <cjd> yeah, I eval'd   print('hello world')  and it came out in the server log  
11:38 <xwikibot> has joined #xwiki  
11:38 <jvelo> cjd: but for the moment we cannot batch "loadDocument" can we ?  
11:38 <Denis> tmortagne: btw, I still have to investigate since I got empty diff as well  
11:38 <jvelo> so you'd still load all documents individually  
11:38 <cjd> not with the current technology, we'd have to do some hacking in XHS (or rewrite it)  
11:39 <Denis> tmortagne: empty diff also happen in the normal ui  
11:39 <tmortagne> Denis: would be nice to report empty diff but it's possible the standard diff UI does not show something that was checked by EM  
11:39 <cjd> but the back end is not the problem IMO, at the back end, being fast is just a matter of sitting down and writing the code, the problem is bad API  
11:39 <tmortagne> Denis: you mean in history view ?  
11:39 <jvelo> one good thing with javascript IMO is sharing templates on the backend and on the frontend  
11:40 <cjd> indeed  
11:40 <tmortagne> when you say "normal UI"  
11:40 <cjd> we could actually have a single unified API which is accessable to the back end and the front end  
11:40 <Denis> tmortagne: yes, I also got that before there, I though it was simply true, but I doubt now  
11:40 <cjd> that would be pretty cool  
11:40 <tmortagne> Denis: if it was in older version it's possible it was because of hidden field  
11:40 <tmortagne> I added it recently to standard diff UI  
11:41 <cjd> and it would prevent any bad synchronous api from growing because it would be miserably slow if it was XMLHttpRequest backed.  
11:41 <tmortagne> it was forgotten when hidden field was introduced  
11:41 <Denis> tmortagne: let me some time, I have some samples I need to compare  
11:41 <Denis> tmortagne: but I should get rid of all that conflict before :)  
11:42 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
11:42 <cjd> Oh the other exciting thing is that unlike Velocity, Rhino generates bytecode so we can trick the jvm into caching native code for our hot pages.  
12:02 <Denis> tmortagne: is there a way to access non-public Maven with EM ?  
12:03 <tmortagne> Denis: yep, you have an auth example in last xwiki.properties  
12:03 <Denis> oh, should be new, I never seen it, but I do not merge properly  
12:03 <tmortagne> yep it's new  
12:04 <tmortagne> see https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-tools/xwiki-platform-tool-configuration-resources/src/main/resources/xwiki.properties.vm#L441  
12:04 <Denis> tmortagne: great !  
12:05 <tmortagne> it passes it to httpclient, I think it supports only BASIC right now  
12:05 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
12:06 <Denis> tmortagne: should work with nexus no ?  
12:06 <tmortagne> Denis: not tested much but I guess yes  
12:07 <tmortagne> I just did a quick test with an apache  
12:08 <Denis> tmortagne: brrr, git an issue while resolving some very last conflicts :(  
12:08 <Denis> Failed to retrieve extension data.Server not responding  
12:09 <tmortagne> during the import ?  
12:09 <Denis> yes, I was asking for keeping current  
12:10 <tmortagne> I don't understand how that's possible since you already downloaded the XAR, you are importing it  
12:10 <tmortagne> could you passe the log around it  
12:10 <Denis> the only logs, are about lucene having an issue with an attachement, nothing else :(  
12:11 <tmortagne> I mean what do you have before "Failed to retrieve extension data.Server not responding", nothing ?  
12:11 <tmortagne> even the info log  
12:11 <tmortagne> want to see what it was doing  
12:12 <tmortagne> I think you were talking about a server side error in the extension log  
12:12 <tmortagne> ?  
12:12 <Denis> http://troll.ws/image/91579e8b  
12:13 <Denis> nothing on the server side  
12:13 <tmortagne> is it ok when you refresh the page ?  
12:13 <mflorea> the message suggests that XWiki was not responding  
12:14 <mflorea> you should try to reload the page

17:29 <vmassol> jvelo: is there an easy way to render a field containing wiki syntax in the livetable?  
17:29 <vmassol> (a string field containing wiki syntax)  
17:35 <tmortagne> vmassol: not sure I understand, you want it to be interpreted or not ?  
17:35 <vmassol> tmortagne: yes interpreted  
17:35 <vmassol> see my last modification  
17:35 <tmortagne> I don't think so and that sounds pretty dangerous  
17:35 <vmassol> I've put it back since I cannot find an easy solution  
17:35 <tmortagne> there is support for html  
17:35 <vmassol> why is that?  
17:36 <vmassol> why is it more dangerous than editing a page?  
17:36 <vmassol> or than having a textarea  
17:36 <tmortagne> because it's not the page containing the syntax which will be executed  
17:36 <vmassol> ?  
17:36 <vmassol> a textarea will interept right?  
17:37 <tmortagne> what textarea ?  
17:37 <vmassol> textarea property type  
17:37 <tmortagne> when you edit something in a page it's executed with you as author  
17:38 <tmortagne> in a livetable it will be executed with whatever page is getting creating the table  
17:38 <tmortagne> it's like with comments that are executed with the  right of the page author  
17:40 <tmortagne> render wiki syntax should always be done very carefully  
17:44 <tmortagne> it mainly depends who has to right to create things that will ends up in the livetable basically  
17:44 <vmassol> how would you approach this use case?  
17:45 <vmassol> I guess we could have 2 fields but it's a bit cumbersome  
17:45 <vmassol> one field for the label and one field for the url  
17:45 <vmassol> developedByName, developedByURL  
17:46 <vmassol> sheet: [[developedByName>>developedByURL]]  
17:46 <vmassol> and in the LT just use developedByName  
17:49 <tmortagne> we can't force using a wiki user ?  
17:50 <vmassol> an org is not really a user  
17:50 <vmassol> it also makes it hard to create new ref for users  
17:50 <tmortagne> we have a XWiki Dev Team user for extensions.xwiki.org for example  
17:50 <tmortagne> but it could also be a developer name and URL separated  
17:52 <tmortagne> a more complex one would be to let user put syntax but it means discarding PR like we do with comments and use the rendering script service to parse and rendering the field content  
17:52 <tmortagne> a bit of a pain in Velocity
